intro: Delphinium macrocentrum, commonly known as the tall larkspur, is a herbaceous perennial native to the western United States. It is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. The plant produces showy, spurred blue to violet flowers in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Delphinium macrocentrum thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soils, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes.
